content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of approximately 9 blocks arranged in 4 distinct layers:
- Bottom layer: 2 blue cubic blocks with a yellow horizontal bar connecting them
- Second layer: 2 orange triangular/wedge-shaped blocks on the sides
- Third layer: 1 orange cylindrical block in the center
- Top layer: 1 red block with a curved opening and 2 yellow semicircular caps

## Spatial Relationships
- The foundation consists of two blue cubes connected by a yellow horizontal bar
- Two orange triangular wedges sit on top of the yellow bar on either side
- An orange cylindrical column rises from the center, positioned between the wedges
- A red block with a curved opening sits on top of the cylindrical column
- Two yellow semicircular caps are placed on top of the red block

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, these are the blocks needed to construct the structure:

1. Block #6 (blue cube) - used twice for the bottom support
2. Block #7 (yellow horizontal bar) - connects the blue cubes
3. Block #15 and #16 (orange triangular wedges) - placed on the sides
4. Block #8 (orange vertical cylinder) - central column
5. Block #2 (red U-shaped block) - forms the top with the curved opening
6. Block #11 (yellow semicircular cap) - used twice for the top caps

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 6
   Step2: Move block with index 6
   Step3: Move block with index 7
   Step4: Move block with index 15
   Step5: Move block with index 16
   Step6: Move block with index 8
   Step7: Move block with index 2
   Step8: Move block with index 11
   Step9: Move block with index 11
}
```

The structure begins with the blue foundation cubes connected by the yellow bar, builds up with the orange wedges and central cylinder, and is topped with the red U-shaped block and yellow caps.
